Title.evidence: We conducted a double-blind randomized trial of oral choline supplementation with lecithin to aid in the treatment of pain after gynaecological surgery.

Trial_Design.evidence: Sixty women having open gynaecological surgery were randomly assigned to receive 20 g of lecithin before surgery or placebo.

Participants.evidence: Sixty women having open gynaecological surgery were randomly assigned to receive 20 g of lecithin before surgery or placebo.

Intervention.evidence: Sixty women having open gynaecological surgery were randomly assigned to receive 20 g of lecithin before surgery or placebo.

Objective.evidence: We conducted a double-blind randomized trial of oral choline supplementation with lecithin to aid in the treatment of pain after gynaecological surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Pain report was the primary outcome measure.

Blinding.evidence: We conducted a double-blind randomized trial of oral choline supplementation with lecithin to aid in the treatment of pain after gynaecological surgery.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Sixty women having open gynaecological surgery were randomly assigned to receive 20 g of lecithin before surgery or placebo.

Result_Outcome.evidence: We achieved a small but statistically significant increase in choline after surgery with oral supplementation.

Harms.evidence: There were no adverse effects of treatment.
